supporting_feedback_snippets: Logging my time at the end of the day takes way too long. I have to click through so many screens just to add time for one project task. It's easily 10-15 minutes wasted.
Making corrections is a nightmare. If I accidentally submit my timesheet before it's complete, getting it back, editing it, and resubmitting involves way too many steps and approvals.
identified_themes.inferred_need_or_pain_point: Users need a more streamlined, efficient process for logging time and making corrections.

supporting_feedback_snippets: I travel a lot for client meetings. It's impossible to log time easily when I'm not at my desk. I wish I could just quickly add entries from my phone right after a meeting.
identified_themes.inferred_need_or_pain_point: Users require the ability to log time from mobile devices for convenience and accuracy.

supporting_feedback_snippets: The overall look is very dated. It feels clunky, and sometimes I'm not sure which button I'm supposed to press to submit my timesheet.
The dropdown list for project codes is massive and in a random order. Finding the right code takes ages, and I've picked the wrong one by mistake more than once because I was rushing.
identified_themes.inferred_need_or_pain_point: Users need an intuitive, modern interface with improved navigation and project code selection.

supporting_feedback_snippets: Why can't I easily see a summary of my hours for the week broken down by project? I need this for my own records, but the portal doesn't offer a simple view like that. Generating reports seems impossible for regular users.
identified_themes.inferred_need_or_pain_point: Users require better visibility into their logged hours and the ability to generate simple reports.

supporting_feedback_snippets: The system becomes incredibly slow, almost unusable, late in the afternoon, especially on Thursdays and Fridays. Trying to submit my timesheet before leaving is frustrating.
identified_themes.inferred_need_or_pain_point: Users need a system that performs consistently, especially during peak usage times.

task_2_survey_design.survey_goal: To gather specific information about user experiences, priorities, and preferences for improving the NovaTime portal's efficiency, usability, and functionality.

survey_questions.question_text: On average, how long does it take you to log your time for a single day?
survey_questions.purpose: To quantify the current time investment required for logging time, helping prioritize efficiency improvements.

survey_questions.question_text: How often do you need to access NovaTime from a mobile device (smartphone or tablet)?
survey_questions.purpose: To assess the demand for mobile accessibility and inform the priority of developing a mobile version.

survey_questions.question_text: Which features would be most valuable to you in an improved NovaTime portal? (Select up to 3)
options: One-click time entry for common tasks
Mobile app for logging time on-the-go
Personal dashboard with weekly hour summaries
Integration with calendar for pre-filling entries
survey_questions.purpose: To identify the most desired features for prioritization in the improvement process.

survey_questions.question_text: How would you rate the current user interface of NovaTime in terms of ease of use?
survey_questions.purpose: To gauge user satisfaction with the current interface and determine the need for UI/UX improvements.

survey_questions.question_text: What is your biggest challenge when using the current NovaTime portal?
survey_questions.purpose: To capture specific pain points and challenges that may not have been anticipated, providing qualitative insights for improvement.

survey_questions.question_text: How frequently do you experience slow performance or system unresponsiveness when using NovaTime?
survey_questions.purpose: To assess the prevalence and impact of performance issues on user experience.

survey_questions.question_text: How likely are you to recommend the current NovaTime portal to a colleague?
survey_questions.purpose: To establish a baseline Net Promoter Score (NPS) for measuring overall satisfaction and tracking improvement over time.

supporting_evidence: Reference to initial_feedback.txt [FDBK_01]: 'Logging my time at the end of the day takes way too long. I have to click through so many screens just to add time for one project task. It's easily 10-15 minutes wasted.'
Reference to scenario_description.txt: The project goal mentions 'increase efficiency for employees logging time' as a key objective.

Reference to initial_feedback.txt [FDBK_03]: 'I travel a lot for client meetings. It's impossible to log time easily when I'm not at my desk. I wish I could just quickly add entries from my phone right after a meeting.'
Reference to scenario_description.txt: The project aims to 'improve the accuracy and reliability of the time tracking data', which mobile access could support by allowing real-time entries.
Reference to initial_feedback.txt [FDBK_02]: 'The overall look is very dated. It feels clunky, and sometimes I'm not sure which button I'm supposed to press to submit my timesheet.'

Reference to initial_feedback.txt [FDBK_08]: 'The dropdown list for project codes is massive and in a random order. Finding the right code takes ages, and I've picked the wrong one by mistake more than once because I was rushing.'

Reference to initial_feedback.txt [FDBK_05]: 'Why can't I easily see a summary of my hours for the week broken down by project? I need this for my own records, but the portal doesn't offer a simple view like that. Generating reports seems impossible for regular users.'

Reference to scenario_description.txt: The background mentions that the data is 'crucial for project costing, client billing, and resource management', suggesting improved reporting could benefit both users and management.

Reference to initial_feedback.txt [FDBK_04]: 'The system becomes incredibly slow, almost unusable, late in the afternoon, especially on Thursdays and Fridays. Trying to submit my timesheet before leaving is frustrating.'

While important, this issue was mentioned less frequently than others in the initial feedback, suggesting it may affect fewer users or have less impact on overall adoption and data accuracy compared to other priorities.
